task.title: Create a GitHub Repository
task.shortdesc: This task will show you how to create a repository in GitHub.

context.p: Learn how to create a GitHub repository. This is the first step that ties everything together. Creating a repository is crucial to the process and will allow you to make a successful website and PDF.

substep.cmd: On the home page, click on the + icon in the upper right-hand corner

fig.title: Screen capture of the GitHub home page where you will find the + button

image.alt: Screen capture of the GitHub home page, with the focus being on a + button in the top right corner with a red circle around it.

substep.cmd: Select “New repository” from the drop-down menu

fig.title: Screen capture of the GitHub home page, where you will find the + button and can then click on "New repository"

image.alt: Screen capture of the GitHub home page, with the focus being on a + button in the top right corner with the dropdown menu open and the focus on the first choice in the menu, a button that says "New repository".

substep.cmd: Enter a unique name for your repository
Add a short description of what this repository is for (optional)
Choose whether you want your repository to be public (visible to everyone) or private (visible only to you and collaborators)

fig.title: Screen capture of page that allows you to create a new GitHub repository

image.alt: Screen capture on GitHub page where you create a new repository. There are red arrows pointing to type in the name of the repository, as well as one pointing to an optional description, and lastly, one pointing to a public or private button.

substep.cmd: Initialize the Repository: If you want GitHub to create the main branch for you, check “Add a README file”. You can also:

ul.li: Add a .gitignore file to specify files Git should ignore

fig.title: Screen capture of additional settings you can add when creating a new GitHub repository

image.alt: Screen capture of bottom of page where you would create a new repository, giving you the option to add a readme file, add a .gitignore, and a license.

substep.cmd: Once you've configured everything, click the green button “Create repository” at the bottom of the page

fig.title: This is where you will click to create your repository

image.alt: Screen capture showing where to click to create your new repository. It is a green button located at the bottom of the page on the right side.

substep.cmd: After creating the repository, you’ll be directed to the repository page

fig.title: Screen capture of your new repository's home page

image.alt: Screen capture showing the home page of your newly created GitHub repository, with many different tools and buttons in sight.

info.p: You now have a GitHub repository created from scratch that you can start adding files to and managing with GitHub commands!
